intro: Thelymitra fimbriata, commonly known as the fringed helmet orchid, is an epiphytic plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique, helmet-shaped flowers with fringed edges. The plant typically grows on the trunks or branches of trees, absorbing moisture and nutrients from the air. Its leaves are usually sword-shaped and arranged in a rosette pattern. Thelymitra fimbriata is known for its striking purple and white floral display, which appears during the warmer months.
